column5: Anyone hear why the truckers are protesting? Man,lots of angry drivers.
When's the protest start?  I just drove up from the big smoke, it was smooth sailing the entire way.
Now I'm worried, I'm going up at 6:30 AM tomorrow...

They/news, on the radio have been reporting it the last three days,but it seems no one can say why. It,s at the truck inspection station. You didnt see aline up of trucks? Maybe I mis heard the hwy #. Maybe it,s the 401.
I would imagine the price of gas....
Before Tybo corrects you Boss,it,s DESIEL.
You mean the stuff that keeps driving up the food prices.
A quick google search pulled up this:Gravel haulers interrupt truck inspections in Milton, North Bay
Thanks bdox.  Guess the price of lettuce is still safe.
Oh OK, I thought it was about me driving in the center lane yesterday....
They started there yesterday, supposedly they are getting fined regularly for being overloaded.  There was about fifty or sixty of them blocking the scales last night causing everybody to rubberneck.
Whoops, thought this thread said 400, I'm safe, for now.
Stuck in the backup the last 2 days. Not crazy about the traffic, but I understand their pains.
I wish they would protest the price of fuel..They are the guys n gals that could actually do somthing...If the trucks stop so does EVERYTHING..
Well if they're that stoopid and can't figure out that overload=ticket, then maybe they should be pushing a wheelbarrow.  Oh right, wheelbarrows don't go 135km/h when overloaded.
It's stamped right on my wheelbarrow tire that I'm not allowed to go on the hiway with it. Takes me darned near forever to get any place having to run down the back roads to avoid the coppers
Oh Lew, you know what kind of damage a mouth full of ham & pea soup does going the wrong direction through your nose, and how the heck do you pick it out of the keyboard...
Sorry bout that   :lol:
LOL!! Good one BB!!
